alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 7:28PM EDT until July 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rains are beginning to wind down across the Charleston Metro Area and nearby communities. Some areas have already observed between 2 and 6 inches of rain so far today. While rainfall rates will slowly diminish through 930 PM, many areas are flooded, including parts of Downtown Charleston where a number of streets are closed and not passable. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch with localized amounts in excess of 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, West Ashley, Daniel Island, Downtown Charleston, Ladson, James Island, Fort Sumter, Johns Island, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Ridgeville and Sullivan`s Island.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
